p: Candida albicans is an opportunistic pathogenic yeast that is a common member of the human gut flora, found in 40 to 80% of normal human beings as commensal in gastrointestinal tract [ 65]. It is usually a commensal organism, but it can become pathogenic under a variety of conditions. It is a commonest cause of candidiasis (moniliasis). Other most common isolate of Candida species are Candida tropicalis, Candida parapsilosis, and Candida glabrata [ 66, 67].
